title: A Problem in --do_data
body:
When I do "python run_bert.py --do_data", I met this problem. My pytorch version is 1.5.0+cuda10.1

`OSError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument: 'D:\\Desktop\\BERT+XLNET Multi-label\\pybert\\output\\log\\bert-2020-05-31-17:54:48.log'`
The complete error message is shown below, is that because the log file is missing?

`(pytorch_gpu) D:\Desktop\BERT+XLNET Multi-label>python run_bert.py --do_data
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run_bert.py", line 216, in <module>
    main()
  File "run_bert.py", line 192, in main
    init_logger(log_file=config['log_dir'] / f'{args.arch}-{time.strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H:%M:%S", time.localtime())}.log')
  File "D:\Desktop\BERT+XLNET Multi-label\pybert\common\tools.py", line 38, in init_logger
    file_handler = logging.FileHandler(log_file)
  File "D:\anaconda\anaconda1\envs\pytorch_gpu\lib\logging\__init__.py", line 1087, in __init__
    StreamHandler.__init__(self, self._open())
  File "D:\anaconda\anaconda1\envs\pytorch_gpu\lib\logging\__init__.py", line 1116, in _open
    return open(self.baseFilename, self.mode, encoding=self.encoding)
OSError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument: 'D:\\Desktop\\BERT+XLNET Multi-label\\pybert\\output\\log\\bert-2020-05-31-17:54:48.log'`

How to fix it? thx.
